history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi(b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 181: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see David Paisey, 'Adolphus Asher (1800-1853): Berlin bookseller, anglophile and friend to Panizzi', in The British Library Journal, 23 [1997], 131-153): inscribed, folio [70v].
